pull.title: rpc: Capture UniValue by ref for rpcdoccheck
pull.body: Capturing it by reference instead of value should save us from making a copy of a potentially large object. Saw this while having a look at #25229 although I couldn't reproduce an actual leak, so this is not a fix for that issue.

events.message: rpc: Capture potentially large UniValue by ref for rpcdoccheck

events.body: https://github.com/bitcoin-core/univalue-subtree/pull/27 might have helped to discover this bug?
Post-merge ACK. Very good catch, I imagine this could result in quite a lot of allocation, copy and reallocation overhead for complex objects.
